data.title: Brad Pitt to play lead role in Quentin Tarantino's next movie 'The Movie Critic'
data.meta_description: Brad Pitt is in talks for starring in the film "The Movie Critic" by Quentin Tarantino, marking the third film by the master auteur in which he has acted in.
data.text:
Synopsis

Brad Pitt is in talks for starring in the film "The Movie Critic" by Quentin Tarantino, marking the third film by the master auteur in which he has acted in.

Quentin Tarantino is getting together with a collaborator from the past for the directorial final film of his. As reported by Variety and Deadline, Brad Pitt is in discussions about starring in the director of 'Pulp Fiction' coming film "The Movie Critic".

Will this be the first film by Quentin Tarantino to mark the presence of Brad Pitt?

This will be marking the third film directed by Quentin Tarantino that Brad Pitt has acted in after the "Inglourious Basterds" of 2009 and "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood" of 2019. Pitt has also made an appearance in the 1993 film "True Romance" directed by Tony Scott and written by Tarantino.

Pitt will be the first member to be cast in "The Movie Critic" by Tarantino, predicted to based on an actual film critic who is admired by the director. It was informed by Tarantino to a news outlet in 2023, that the film is based in California in 1977 and is on the life of a guy living life but not becoming very famous, writing movie reviews for a porno rag.

It was not clear on an immediate basis whether Pitt who is 60 years old would be portraying the character of the title movie critic, though earlier it was told by Tarantino that the film's actor would be a new leading man for him and would be near the age of 35 years old.

The award for the Oscars Best Supporting Actor for "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood" by Tarantino was won by Brad Pitt, witnessing him to play the role of a stuntman, Cliff Booth facing Leonardo DiCaprio in 1969 Hollywood.

The film which got nominations for as many as 10 Academy Awards including that for best picture was successful at the box office with a gross revenue of around $400 million globally.

When is Quentin Tarantino retiring from directing films?

Tarantino who is 60 years old has for several years stated that he is planning to retire from directing films after his 10th movie for maintaining a consistent superior quality in his filmography. This would be making "The Movie Critic" the final movie of Tarantino with the director considering his two-part "Kill Bill" saga a single movie.

A confirmed release date or distributor has not been disclosed for "The Movie Critic."

FAQs:

Q1. Who is in talks for starring in the film "The Movie Critic"?

A1. Brad Pitt is in discussions for starring as the director of 'Pulp Fiction', Quentin Tarantino's coming film "The Movie Critic". This will be marking the third film directed by Quentin Tarantino that Brad Pitt has acted in after the "Inglourious Basterds" of 2009 and "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood" of 2019.

Q2. When is Quentin Tarantino retiring from directing films?

A2. Tarantino who is 60 years old has for several years stated that he is planning to retire from directing films after his 10th movie to maintain a consistent superior quality in his filmography. This would be making "The Movie Critic" the final movie of Tarantino.
